description:
If libvirt wasn't compiled with the appropriate flags, listDevices may return NOT_SUPPORTED.

This is currently not gracefully handled, which prevents the compute node from starting up.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/75375/

A better fix is to handle the error, and issue a warning when we detect this case.
title: virNodeListDevices may not be supported

comments.content:
If libvirt wasn't compiled with the appropriate flags, listDevices may return NOT_SUPPORTED.

This is currently not gracefully handled, which prevents the compute node from starting up.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/75375/

A better fix is to handle the error, and issue a warning when we detect this case.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rconradharris

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/86191
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/86191
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=3012eab2f7e70796ddc06d211dbc76bcf62c3736
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 3012eab2f7e70796ddc06d211dbc76bcf62c3736
Author: Rick Harris <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Apr 8 18:49:22 2014 -0500

    libvirt: Handle `listDevices` unsupported exception
    
    It's possible that `listDevices` will return an exception if it's not
    currently supported.
    
    If this happens, the compute service will fail to start up.
    
    The proposed solution is to catch this error, log a warning, and allow
    the compute-service to continue initialization.
    
    Change-Id: If152abd1080e9ba395de5d8ea10f5e0c476d4e2b
    Closes-Bug: #1304721
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
